title: Valentino trying to stop auction of 'stolen' dress worn by Lady Gaga to Golden Globes
text:
A dress worn by Lady Gaga to this year’s Golden Globes awards has become the subject of a furious row after it was put up for sale by a hotel cleaner who found it, without the consent of the designer.

Gaga wore the periwinkle-blue silk gown in homage to a dress worn by Judy Garland in the 1954 version of A Star Is Born.

After the January ceremony she left the dress at the Beverly Hilton hotel where she was staying, and where the awards were hosted, as she expected a team from Valentino, the designer, to collect it.

Gaga has since stated that the dress was never her property, but it was merely on loan from the label.
